article.title: rMake Management
article.para: The rMake Management page is used to manage the multi-node rMake server on this Appliance. This interface can be used to start and stop the rMake server or worker nodes and to view build status and logs.

sect1.title: rMake Server Management
sect1.para: This rMake server can be controlled from this interface. The start, stop, restart, and reset, buttons are active when their use is appropriate.
The reset button is used to clear everything in the current rmake repository and database.

sect1.title: rMake Node Management
sect1.para: rMake worker nodes can be controlled from this interface. The start, stop, restart, and reset, buttons are active when their use is appropriate.
The reset button is used to clear the cache and chroots used by each worker node.
The edit button can be used to modify the slots and chrootLimit settings for each worker node.

slots -- Maximum number of individual packages (not jobs) to build in parallel within a single job on one rMake node.
chrootLimit -- Number of chroots that should be allowed to be created on this node at the same time. After this point, old chroots will be deleted.
Click Save to save changes or click Cancel to revert.

sect1.title: Builds
sect1.para: Build status and logs can be viewed in this section.
